The study suggests most ‘healthy’ young males in Oman have inadequate vitamin C intake, and corroborates the increasing evidence that inadequate vitamin C intake is involved in the etiology of the modern non-communicable pathologies such as cancer, type 2 diabetes, and cardiovascular disease.

Unsurprisingly:

Diets rich in fresh fruits and vegetables are protective against non-communicable and degenerative diseases. The beneficial effects of fruits and vegetables are hypothesised to be mainly due to vitamin C and other phytochemicals.
